title: BALANCE
description: A set of scales holds day and night in balance. This card deals with many aspects of balance, or with things being out of balance.

upright_meaning.person: A fair-minded person who can see multiple perspectives and judge impartially.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A trap, a Beast, a Construct, or an otherwise impartial foe.
upright_meaning.place: A place where different forces exist in balance—such as a civilization in balance with nature, a land in balance with water, or chaos in balance with order.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure with value to two competing factions, or with two equal magical powers.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation where maintaining balance is important: keeping rivals satisfied, preserving the balance of power among different authorities, or rejecting false dichotomies and forced choices.

reversed_meaning.person: A judgmental or biased person willfully ignoring one perspective in favor of another.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Celestial, a Fiend, or some other creature strongly associated with a particular alignment or ideology.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where the balance of elemental or natural forces has been upset, with negative consequences.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure valuable only to certain people, or that can be used only in a very specific way.
reversed_meaning.situation: Something being over- or undervalued.

title: BEAST
description: The Beast card points to creatures of the animal kingdom and foul, cruel, or bad-tempered behavior in people.

upright_meaning.person: A person who avoids the comforts of civilization or indulges predatory attitudes.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Beast, or a similar creature (such as a Fey or a Monstrosity) that is animal-like; alternatively, a pit or other confined space with a trapped animal within.
upright_meaning.place: A place where animals roam freely.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that incorporates fur, feathers, bones, or claws from a Beast, or a magic item that allows transformation into a Beast (such as a Cloak of the Bat or Staff of the Python).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation involving hunting animals or animals preying on people.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who fiercely represses urges they deem “bestial” in themselves or others.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A domesticated animal or a familiar.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where animals are contained, such as a farm or a zoo.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An ornate saddle, a goad, or another item related to the use of domestic animals, or a magic item that allows control of Beasts (such as a Potion of Animal Friendship).
reversed_meaning.situation: Domestic animals rebelling against people’s control.

title: BOOK
description: An enormous book rests among scrolls and parchment, with a quill and ink nearby. The Book card embodies written information.

upright_meaning.person: A writer, poet, or compulsive note-taker.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that keeps an exhaustive diary in some form, or that seeks a scribe to record its deeds.
upright_meaning.place: A scriptorium or printing press.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable or magical pen, an ink vial, or a set of pigments (such as Nolzur’s Marvelous Pigments).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires gleaning information from written clues.

reversed_meaning.person: A well-educated person who reads often.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A trap involving written runes (such as a Glyph of Warding or Symbol spell).
reversed_meaning.place: A library or another storehouse of written knowledge.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A valuable or magical written work, such as a book or scroll.
reversed_meaning.situation: Secrets that should never have been discovered but were written down.

title: BRIDGE
description: A stone bridge arcs across a waterway. A shadowy figure lurks under the bridge, only its gleaming eyes clearly visible. This card reflects the effort required to overcome obstacles.

upright_meaning.person: A mediator who enjoys helping others overcome misunderstandings or grievances.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: Someone who coordinates the efforts of different kinds of creatures, such as a mind flayer mastermind using grimlocks and trolls as agents.
upright_meaning.place: A bridge across a river or chasm.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting a bridge, or a magic item intended to help overcome obstacles (such as Boots of Striding and Springing).
upright_meaning.situation: An urgent need for bridges between long-opposed factions.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who is part of a longstanding feud between two families or groups.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that lairs near, on, or under a bridge and either collects tolls from those using the bridge or tries to eat them.
reversed_meaning.place: A river or chasm with no bridge, or where the bridge is unsafe or has collapsed.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting walls, barriers, or a labyrinth; alternatively, a magic item that creates magical walls (such as a Cube of Force).
reversed_meaning.situation: Open conflict between two families or groups.

title: CAMPFIRE
description: A large campfire offers safety and comfort in the night. This card suggests a need for rest.

upright_meaning.person: A person on vacation, enjoying time away from work and pursuing activities they enjoy.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that alternates brief periods of activity with long periods of rest (as many reptiles and Dragons do); alternatively, a trap that requires a long time to reset between activations.
upright_meaning.place: A place recently used as a campsite.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting a peaceful scene, or a magic item that facilitates safe rest (such as a Rod of Security).
upright_meaning.situation: A period of rest in the middle of a journey or an adventure.

reversed_meaning.person: An exhausted person.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature immune to exhaustion (such as an angel, a golem, an Ooze, or an Undead), or a trap or hazard with a constant, ongoing effect.
reversed_meaning.place: Somewhere not conducive to rest, such as a busy marketplace active at all hours.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object that suggests frenetic activity, or a magic item that helps its user remain alert (such as a Sentinel Shield).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that demands unrelenting activity.

title: CAVERN
description: A vast cavern is adorned with glowing fungi and striking stone formations. The Cavern card suggests exploration and delving into hidden secrets.

upright_meaning.person: A person who asks probing questions but shares little.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature (such as a piercer or a roper) that mimics the features of natural caverns.
upright_meaning.place: A cavern or a cavernous building such as a large temple.
upright_meaning.treasure: A geode, jewelry made from gems and precious metals, or a magic item that grants darkvision (such as Goggles of Night).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires delving into hidden motivations and secrets.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who lives for the moment, avoiding introspection.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that swallows prey whole, or a trap that causes a ceiling or roof to collapse.
reversed_meaning.place: A small niche or cave.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object that lacks a sense of depth or perspective.
reversed_meaning.situation: Everyone’s motivations exposed for all to see.

title: CELESTIAL
description: A beautiful couatl twines through the clouds. This card suggests the involvement of celestial beings and service to the divine.

upright_meaning.person: A devout person who looks for miracles and the presence of the divine in all parts of life.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Celestial or other creature that has connections to the gods, or a trap that deals radiant damage.
upright_meaning.place: A location on the Upper Planes, or a place suffused with their influence.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting angels or other Celestials, treasure from the Upper Planes, or magic items made by Celestials.
upright_meaning.situation: Communication between the Upper Planes and the Material Plane—perhaps in dreams or visions, or with Celestials as intermediaries.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone who carries a grudge over a real or perceived injury caused by a god or Celestial.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A fallen Celestial or similar creature that has lost its connection to the divine.
reversed_meaning.place: A place intended to ward off Celestials and influence from the Upper Planes.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure depicting a Celestial’s fall, or a magic item useful against Celestials.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation involving Celestials’ unwelcome interference in mortal affairs.

title: COMET
description: A comet with an enormous tail streaks across the winter sky at night, outshining the stars. The Comet card brings dire warnings or devastation.

upright_meaning.person: A serious person with a gloomy outlook, perhaps carrying bad news.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature regarded as an ill omen, or signs that a dire creature approaches; alternatively, a trap marked by clear signs, perhaps surrounded by the corpses of its victims.
upright_meaning.place: A place with a connection to astronomical events: perhaps an observatory or a meteorite’s crater.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that carries a curse, or one whose power is destined to be used for destructive ends.
upright_meaning.situation: A crisis about to spiral out of control.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who is grieving or delights in the suffering of others.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: The destruction left in the wake of a rampaging creature, or smaller creatures fleeing from a larger one.
reversed_meaning.place: A ruin where a terrible event occurred in the past and that might now be haunted.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure formed or shaped by disaster, bloodstained or haunted by former owners; alternatively, something good arising from a bad situation.
reversed_meaning.situation: The calm after a devastating storm; a situation where people are reeling from awful news or events.

title: CORPSE
description: An adventurer lies dead in a dungeon hallway, pierced by arrows. The Corpse card embodies decay and corruption.

upright_meaning.person: An evil person whose morality has rotted away.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A zombie or similar corpo- real Undead whose flesh is decaying, or a trapped corpse.
upright_meaning.place: Somewhere things are left to rot, such as a graveyard or charnel house.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting dead bodies, a corpse just starting to decay, or a magic item that causes decay (such as a Staff of Withering).
upright_meaning.situation: An organization or institution over- whelmed by corruption.

reversed_meaning.person: A good person who remains uncorrupted despite being surrounded by wickedness.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Ooze or fungus creature that facilitates the decomposition of corpses.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where fungus grows abundantly on a diet of rotting flesh.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that remains uncorrupted in the midst of rot.
reversed_meaning.situation: An attempt to corrupt a respected and noble organization.

title: DONJON
description: Underground stairs lead to a heavy door made of iron bars. This card represents both imprisonment and freedom.

upright_meaning.person: A prisoner, or a person who feels trapped.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that grapples or swal- lows prey whole.
upright_meaning.place: A place of imprisonment, such as a literal dungeon or a menagerie.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure locked in a vault, or magic with the power to bind or imprison.
upright_meaning.situation: An impasse, a situation that threatens someone's freedom, or a situation where some- one's indecision is keeping everyone in suspense.

reversed_meaning.person: A recently freed or escaped prisoner, or a free thinker who rejects social norms.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that has escaped from captivity or gone feral.
reversed_meaning.place: A prison broken open, or a place associated with liberation (such as a monument commemo- rating emancipation).
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that once held a being captive, such as an Efreeti Bottle that has lost its magic or an empty Iron Flask.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that requires creative solu- tions, or an effort to free people or creatures from Captivity.

title: DRAGON
description: A menacing red dragon perches atop its treasure hoard inside a cave. This card can point to things connected to Dragons, but it also suggests hoarding, greed, and places rich in magical energy.

upright_meaning.person: A dragonborn, a person who uses draconic magic, a person who is fascinated by dragons, or a person who hoards wealth or other goods.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Dragon or similar creature.
upright_meaning.place: The lair of a Dragon or some other impres- sive creature, or a site of great magical power.
upright_meaning.treasure: Large quantities of treasure, though not necessarily of great monetary value (for example, many copper coins or a large collection of cheap statuettes).
upright_meaning.situation: Someone hoarding resources that are widely needed or desired.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone with a grudge against a particu- lar Dragon or against Dragons in general.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A dracolich or another Undead dragon, a Construct that resembles a Dragon, or another Dragon-like creature.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where a Dragon was slain, leaving a magical or physical scar on the land.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting the death of a Dragon, or a magic item useful against Dragons (such as a Dragon Slayer).
reversed_meaning.situation: A group that plans to drive a Dragon from its lair, steal from its hoard, or kill it.

title: EURYALE
description: A female medusa with a serpentine tail instead of legs is surrounded by flowers and herbs. The Euryale card points to vision, insight, and observation.

upright_meaning.person: A person who observes without becoming involved or attached.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A medusa or another creature with the power to petrify or a gaze attack.
upright_meaning.place: Somewhere with commanding views, such as a watchtower or a high promontory.
upright_meaning.treasure: A landscape painting or tapestry, or a magic item that enhances vision (such as Goggles of Night).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that rewards or requires care- ful observation, such as a surveillance operation.

reversed_meaning.person: A nosy person who inserts themself into situations where they don’t belong.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature made of or associated with stone.
reversed_meaning.place: A place with narrow windows (perhaps arrow slits) or with a limited view, perhaps underground.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A valuable sculpture or statue, a gem- stone, or a magic item made from stone, such as a Figurine of Wondrous Power.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation arising from people’s unwill- ingness to observe things as they are, or their ten- dency to project their own feelings and opinions onto others.

title: FATES
description: Three sisters weave, measure, and cut the threads of fate. This card explores the repercussions of decisions and reflects on the past.

upright_meaning.person: A person perhaps nearing the end of their life, troubled by past mistakes or reflecting on prior decisions.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A supernatural creature con- nected to fate, such as a Celestial, modron, or hag.
upright_meaning.place: Somewhere meant for literal or metaphor- ical reflection, such as a room full of mirrors, a still mountain lake, a monastery, a hermitage, or a library.
upright_meaning.treasure: An ornate or magical mirror, tapestry, or other woven treasure; alternatively, magic that can alter fate.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation ordained by fate, perhaps in- volving a supernatural punishment or reward.

reversed_meaning.person: A person driven by the desire to escape whatever fate has in store.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature strongly associated with chaos, such as a demon or a slaad.
reversed_meaning.place: A place that discourages reflection, such as a dark place or a noisy, busy one.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting the effort to escape fate, or a magic item powered by chaos.
reversed_meaning.situation: An unjust situation where evil is re- warded and good is punished.

title: FIEND
description: A balor strikes from the depths of the Abyss. This card alludes to an actual Fiend or the forces of the Lower Planes.

upright_meaning.person: A tiefling, warlock of the Fiend, member of a Fiend-worshipping cult, or person who seeks to manipulate others into harmful contracts.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Fiend of any sort.
upright_meaning.place: A place on the Lower Planes, or a location suffused with their influence.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting Fiends, treasure from the Lower Planes, or magic items made by Fiends.
upright_meaning.situation: Interaction between the Lower Planes and the Material Plane—perhaps an infernal bar- gain or demonic destruction.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who carries a grudge over a real or perceived injury caused by a Fiend, or a person trapped in a bargain with a Fiend.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A redeemed Fiend or simi- lar creature that has lost its connection to the Lower Planes.
reversed_meaning.place: A place intended to ward off Fiends and in- fluence from the Lower Planes.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure depicting a Fiend’s redemp- tion, or a magic item useful against Fiends.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation involving Fiends’ unwelcome interference in mortal affairs.

title: FOOL
description: A person walks down a path, unwittingly dropping items along the way. The Fool card represents innocence.

upright_meaning.person: An innocent or naive person blissfully igno- rant of the world’s sinister side, possibly a child.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A naive Celestial or a flighty Fey, or a trap with a simple or obvious means of avoiding it.
upright_meaning.place: A place connected with children, such as a nursery, an orphanage, or a school.
upright_meaning.treasure: A portrait of a child, jewelry meant for a child, or a magic item connected to the Upper Planes.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation requiring trust, honesty, and a leap of faith.

reversed_meaning.person: A con artist who preys on the innocent and gullible while presenting a trustworthy facade.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that changes its shape to appear harmless so it can get close to its prey, or a trap that is difficult to avoid.
reversed_meaning.place: A place tied to the loss of innocence, such as a harsh orphanage or exploitative workhouse.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure stolen from a child or naive person, or magic intended to deceive (such as a Hat of Disguise).
reversed_meaning.situation: A guileless person being manipulated by schemers.

title: GIANT
description: A hungry troll lurks in a forest clearing. The Giant card indicates something very large or that looms large in one’s perception.

upright_meaning.person: A family member, a dear friend, or another personally important individual; alternatively, a very tall person.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Giant, a giant animal, or an- other big creature.
upright_meaning.place: A place constructed by Giants, or a place of great personal significance.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure made by Giants, or one of great sentimental value.
upright_meaning.situation: Someone attaching outsize importance to one element of the situation, to the neglect of other factors.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who seems insignificant.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Tiny creature that’s a greater threat than its size suggests.
reversed_meaning.place: Somewhere destroyed by Giants.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure depicting or commemorating the slaying of a Giant, or a magic item useful against Giants (such as a Giant Slayer).
reversed_meaning.situation: Someone unable or unwilling to recog- nize the importance of a critical factor.

title: JESTER
description: A person wearing jester’s motley and holding a staff rests his foot on a skull. This card deals with the relationship between humor and misfortune.

upright_meaning.person: An optimistic person who laughs at their own misfortune.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A monster some consider silly, such as a flumph, an owlbear, or a gelat- inous cube.
upright_meaning.place: A place dedicated to amusement, such as a fairground or a feasting hall.
upright_meaning.treasure: A humorous art object or magic item, such as a Wand of Wonder.
upright_meaning.situation: A hilarious situation stemming from mis- communication and misplaced assumptions.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who laughs at the misfortunes of others.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with an unsettling laugh, such as a gnoll or hyena, or a creature with a cruel sense of humor.
reversed_meaning.place: A place associated with cruelty and pain, such as a torture chamber.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting pain or humilia- tion, or a magic item meant to inflict pain (such as a Sword of Wounding).
reversed_meaning.situation: One misfortune piling on another in a way that would be humorous—if it weren’t disastrous.

title: KNIGHT
description: A knight formed of folded cards offers a sword also made from cards. The Knight card signifies trust and loyalty.

upright_meaning.person: A trustworthy person who honors their commitments.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature bound by oaths or who serves someone else.
upright_meaning.place: A place of sanctuary, where strong traditions protect those who take shelter inside.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure celebrating or commemorat- ing an oath (such as a wedding ring), or magic weapons or armor associated with knights or paladins.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires loyalty in one’s companions and faithfulness to them.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who can’t be trusted, or a traitor posing as a loyal friend.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A knight who has failed to live up to their code of honor (such as a death knight).
reversed_meaning.place: A place where a great betrayal took place, or a location with treacherous terrain or traps.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that carries a hidden curse, or a magic item that fails when it’s needed most.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation involving the betrayal of trust, or rampant suspicion.

title: MAGE
description: A warlock holds a black crystalline staff. This card suggests both mental acuity and arcane magic.

upright_meaning.person: A person (perhaps a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard) who uses arcane magic or other special- ized learning.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with abilities similar to those of a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard.
upright_meaning.place: A place dedicated to the study of arcane magic or that is suffused with such magic.
upright_meaning.treasure: A magic item such as a wand or staff, or a wizard’s spellbook.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires and rewards the correct use of arcane magic.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who wrongly believes their good luck is the result of innate magical ability or a magical good luck charm.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that resists or negates magic.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where magic has caused destruc- tion, doesn’t work (like the effect of an Antimagic Field), or works unpredictably (perhaps triggering wild magic surges).
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object created by the use of magic, or a magic item with unpredictable effects (such as a Wand of Wonder).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation caused by magic misused or out of control.

title: MAZE
description: Unfortunate souls are trapped in an elaborate and impossible maze of cards. Those who draw the Maze card are lost.

upright_meaning.person: A person who feels lost in their own life, unsure how to affect change, or a person with a wandering mind who takes their time getting to the point.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A minotaur or another creature that hunts in a maze or is imprisoned in a maze.
upright_meaning.place: A maze, or a region (such as a forest or des- ert) where becoming lost is very easy.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting confusion or disorientation, or a magic item that can cause these states.
upright_meaning.situation: A confusing situation where it’s difficult to perceive all the factors at play.

reversed_meaning.person: A person running from expectations placed on them by family and society, trying to find a new path in life.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature whose behavior is unpredictable.
reversed_meaning.place: A simple labyrinth designed for meditation or to provide private nooks, or a location in which one is unlikely to get lost (such as a cave with only one exit).
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object incorporating a laby- rinth design.
reversed_meaning.situation: A search for something or someone that has gone missing.

title: MONSTROSITY
description: An owlbear sits in a sunny glade. This card represents something monstrous, including familiar things that turn strange and threatening.

upright_meaning.person: A familiar person whose behavior suddenly turns threatening.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Monstrosity, especially one that superficially resembles an ordinary animal or person (such as a displacer beast or doppelganger).
upright_meaning.place: A familiar place that has become dangerous.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting a Monstrosity or that incorporates claws, fur, or feathers from such a creature.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation involving something or someone becoming more monstrous (literally or figuratively).

reversed_meaning.person: A person who seems dangerous or bizarre but is friendly and helpful.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Monstrosity that is a potential ally, such as a hippogriff.
reversed_meaning.place: A place that offers refuge in unfamiliar or dangerous terrain.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A dead Monstrosity preserved by taxidermy, or a magic item useful against Mon- strosities.
reversed_meaning.situation: Something that appears monstrous but is actually benign.

title: OOZE
description: A gelatinous cube with various items suspended inside it creeps through a vaulted sewer. The Ooze card indicates the importance of something that seems lowly or innocuous.

upright_meaning.person: A quiet, unassuming person who has hid- den power or secret knowledge.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Ooze or another creature that seems unimportant, or a trap that is surprisingly simple and straightforward.
upright_meaning.place: A humble place of surprising comfort or importance.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that is valuable but not beauti- ful, such as a poorly crafted piece of jewelry incor- porating precious stones.
upright_meaning.situation: Something important that has been over- looked because it seems ordinary.

reversed_meaning.person: A quiet, unassuming person completely out of their depth.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Ooze that has developed curiosity, unexpected intelligence, and a way to communicate, or a dangerous trap that is difficult to detect.
reversed_meaning.place: A humble place with little to offer.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting an Ooze or the destruction of a particularly notable Ooze; alter- natively, a magic item useful against Oozes (such as a Ring of Acid Resistance).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation complicated by the sheer number of minor factors tangled within it.

title: PIT
description: A deep hole studded with spikes gapes in the earth. The Pit card represents a literal or metaphorical fall—losing status, wealth, or position.

upright_meaning.person: A person who has lost significant wealth, social status, or favor.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A pit trap, or a scavenger lurking at the bottom of a pit.
upright_meaning.place: A pit or cliff that creates the risk of a fall.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting someone’s calam- itous fall, or a magic item that allows falling safely (such as a Ring of Feather Falling).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation involving someone’s fall from grace.

reversed_meaning.person: A person in a precarious position who soon will have a calamitous fall.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature (such as a piercer) that attacks by falling on prey.
reversed_meaning.place: An abandoned mansion or palace that is in disrepair due to the owner’s downfall.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting flight or incorpo- rating feathers, or a magic item that grants flight (such as Winged Boots or a Cloak of the Bat).
reversed_meaning.situation: A conspiracy to cause the downfall of a wealthy or prominent person.

title: PRIEST
description: A cleric holds a heavy mace. The Priest card represents wisdom, insight, closeness to the divine, and divine magic.

upright_meaning.person: A person (perhaps a cleric, druid, or pala- din) who uses divine magic or is very pious.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with abilities similar to those of a cleric, druid, or paladin.
upright_meaning.place: A temple, shrine, or similar place conse- crated to a deity or natural force.
upright_meaning.treasure: A magic item such as a Staff of Healing or a Holy Avenger; alternatively, valuable temple accoutrements.
upright_meaning.situation: A problem that requires and rewards piety or the use of divine magic.

reversed_meaning.person: A person devoted to a false god, or a cause that isn’t worthy of devotion.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A demon or another creature op- posed to the gods.
reversed_meaning.place: A place that was consecrated but that has been abandoned or converted to secular use.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An idol depicting an invented god or a demon lord.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation caused by impiety or mis- guided zealotry.

title: PUZZLE
description: An elaborate puzzle box floats in the air, glowing from within. The Puzzle card speaks to intelligence and strategic thinking.

upright_meaning.person: A person with a keen mind for puzzles, or one who delights in clever banter and wordplay.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A brilliant creature that relies on careful plans and tactics rather than brute strength, or a trap that can be bypassed by solv- ing a puzzle or riddle.
upright_meaning.place: A place with hidden doors and other secrets.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure whose function or value isn’t immediately apparent.
upright_meaning.situation: A complex situation with many inter- connected factors.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who is very literal and direct.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that delights in straightforward melee combat, relying on strength to overpower its foes.
reversed_meaning.place: A place with a simple, symmetrical floor plan.
reversed_meaning.treasure: Coins or other treasure whose value is obvious and almost universally understood.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that’s exactly what it appears to be.

title: ROGUE
description: A roguish kenku lurking in the shadows holds a dagger, poised to strike. This card suggests treachery and deception.

upright_meaning.person: A deceptive person hiding a sinister secret; pursuit of their own aims trumps any friendship or loyalty.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A dangerous creature that strikes by surprise or from darkness.
upright_meaning.place: A front for a criminal operation, or a mon- ster’s lair.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that hides a deadly secret, such as a ring with a spring-loaded poison needle, a Dagger of Venom, or a cursed magic item.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation rooted in or destined for betrayal.

reversed_meaning.person: A good-hearted person entangled in a criminal or evil organization who is desperate for a way out.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature unwillingly bound to the service of villains.
reversed_meaning.place: An oasis of compassion surrounded by violence.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure caked in grime or hidden in a filthy place.
reversed_meaning.situation: Good characters who are part of an evil organization or who plot to subvert it.

title: SAGE
description: The mind of a sage is filled with obscure lore gained through exhaustive research. This card represents well-intentioned advice.

upright_meaning.person: A person who offers helpful advice in diffi- cult circumstances.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A helpful creature that leads the way to safety or a goal.
upright_meaning.place: A place dedicated to knowledge and wisdom, such as a library or university.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable or magical book or scroll, or a sentient magic item that is known to provide helpful advice.
upright_meaning.situation: An opportunity to provide valuable ad- vice on a familiar subject.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone who helpfully offers bad advice.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that tries to lead the way into danger or a trap.
reversed_meaning.place: A place whose structural flaws threaten its integrity.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A device valuable for its components that doesn’t function as intended, or a sentient magic item that provides bad but well-intentioned advice.
reversed_meaning.situation: An opportunity to provide advice on a completely unfamiliar subject.

title: SHIP
description: A three-masted ship with a couatl figurehead sails across the open sea. The Ship card indicates a long journey, not necessarily by sea.

upright_meaning.person: A person who routinely travels long dis- tances, such as a sailor, pilgrim, or nomad.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that hunts a large ter- ritory or migrates great distances.
upright_meaning.place: A port city, harbor, caravansary, or similar hub for travelers.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting ships or travel, or a magic item that facilitates travel (such as a Folding Boat).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires travel, or one that unfolds while traveling.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who dreams of travel but has never wandered far from home.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that rarely leaves its lair—and is more powerful there.
reversed_meaning.place: An isolated place that rarely sees travelers.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure still in the hands of the per- son who made it, or a magic item (such as Dimen- sional Shackles) that prevents magical movement.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation arising from someone’s in- ability or unwillingness to travel.

title: STAFF
description: An elegant black staff leans against a wall, waiting for its owner to return. The Staff card represents support or assistance.

upright_meaning.person: A person who offers physical, financial, or emotional support.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature used as a mount or a tracker, or another sort of ally.
upright_meaning.place: A place where support is offered or found, such as a library or a tavern.
upright_meaning.treasure: A magic staff, a jeweled cane or mobility aid, or a similar treasure.
upright_meaning.situation: A group or organization that offers much- needed support.

reversed_meaning.person: A person in desperate need of assistance.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that’s helpless or ineffective unless it can possess or be carried by another creature.
reversed_meaning.place: A place in immediate crisis, such as a loca- tion suddenly imperiled by fire or flood.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that needs repair before re- gaining its full value or magical potency.
reversed_meaning.situation: A group of people who need help from others.

title: STAR
description: A brilliant star shines in the spring sky at twilight. The Star card represents inherent ability and training working in concert—nature allied with nurture.

upright_meaning.person: A person focused on improving a particular area of skill or behavior.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that has trained to improve itself (perhaps having several skill or saving throw proficiencies), or a trap that requires teamwork to avoid or escape.
upright_meaning.place: A place dedicated to study or training, such as a university or gymnasium.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object that reflects the skill of its creator, or a magic item that grants proficiency.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires or rewards training and practice.

reversed_meaning.person: A person with natural ability but little patience for training or study.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that relies on its nat- ural abilities instead of training (perhaps with no skill or saving throw proficiencies).
reversed_meaning.place: A place of untouched natural beauty.
reversed_meaning.treasure: Unrefined ore or uncut gems, or a magic item that improves an ability score.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation resulting from someone’s refusal to practice or train.

title: SUN
description: A sun blazes brightly in the summer sky. The Sun card brings hope—either well-founded or deluded.

upright_meaning.person: A person with an unflappable and opti- mistic outlook, confident in the power of good triumphing over evil and obstacles.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An angel or a similar creature that embodies hope and good.
upright_meaning.place: A place that embodies hope in the face of despair, such as a temple next to a graveyard or a town rebuilding after a natural disaster.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable religious object devoted to good, or a holy or protective magic item.
upright_meaning.situation: A difficult situation where hope neverthe- less continues to shine like a beacon.

reversed_meaning.person: A naively positive person who spouts empty platitudes about everything turning out for the best.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature (perhaps a flumph or a pixie) that offers aid but is too weak to provide meaningful help.
reversed_meaning.place: A desecrated temple or similar place where dirt or corruption has eliminated all evidence of goodness and holiness.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A religious object or holy magic item that has been desecrated.
reversed_meaning.situation: Idealistic optimism that prevents people from responding to real danger.

title: TAVERN
description: An adventuring party eats and laughs in a busy tavern. The Tavern card points to the pleasure of spending time with friends.

upright_meaning.person: A genial person who delights in telling sto- ries in good company.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A social creature that travels in packs.
upright_meaning.place: A tavern, restaurant, or similar place where people gather and eat socially.
upright_meaning.treasure: A jeweled goblet or other treasure related to eating and drinking.
upright_meaning.situation: A tavern brawl.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who ruins the happiness of pleas- ant company.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A parasite, vampire, or similar creature that siphons strength, happiness, or vitality from others, or a trap designed to separate those caught in it.
reversed_meaning.place: A place once used for social gatherings but now abandoned.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A jeweled goblet or similar treasure stained with blood or holding the remnants of poison.
reversed_meaning.situation: An attempt to kill many people at once as they gather for a meal.

title: THRONE
description: An ostentatious throne stands on a dais, with a crown on the seat and a ceremonial sword leaning against one armrest. This card represents the authority of worldly rulers.

upright_meaning.person: A person who enjoys exercising authority over others and expects to be obeyed.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that leads others of its kind; alternatively, one with magical powers of influence or command.
upright_meaning.place: A place of authority, such as a palace or a mayor’s office.
upright_meaning.treasure: A ruler’s regalia, or a magic item (such as a Rod of Rulership) that imparts magical authority.
upright_meaning.situation: A contest over who rightfully holds authority.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who resents authority im- posed on them.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that unwillingly serves another.
reversed_meaning.place: A place at the edge of a ruler’s authority or on the border between rival nations.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object created as an act of resis- tance to tyranny, or a magic item that protects against restraint (such as a Ring of Free Action).
reversed_meaning.situation: A group of people rebelling against a ruler or an authority figure.

title: TOWER
description: A tall, ornate tower made of black stone looms over a desolate landscape. The Tower card represents isolation.

upright_meaning.person: A person who prefers solitude to the com- pany of others.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A reclusive creature.
upright_meaning.place: A remote tower or similar place of isolation.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting an isolated place or a lonely person; alternatively, Daern’s Instant Fortress or a similar magic item.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires assistance or information from a reclusive person.

reversed_meaning.person: A desperately lonely person who craves close companionship.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature cut off from others of its kind that is trying to find them, or a trap that targets a single creature.
reversed_meaning.place: A place that discourages interaction with others, such as a library or monastery, where rules of silence are strictly enforced.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object expressing the artist’s pro- found loneliness.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation arising from someone’s lone- liness or boredom.

title: UNDEAD
description: A lich beckons souls of the dead. This card can point to anything that refuses to die, from old grudges and unresolved issues to Undead creatures.

upright_meaning.person: A person nursing a grudge beyond reason.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Undead creature sustained by a thirst for revenge or an unfinished task, such as a ghost or revenant.
upright_meaning.place: A place haunted (literally or emotionally) by a terrible event that happened there.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure depicting the dead or an Un- dead, something made from bones, or a magic item made by or for an Undead.
upright_meaning.situation: Someone who refuses to leave the past in the past.

reversed_meaning.person: A person too quick to forgive and for- get, who never holds anyone accountable for their misdeeds.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Undead creature that craves an end to its miserable, interminable existence.
reversed_meaning.place: A place whose denizens have forgotten sig- nificant events that happened there.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting the destruction of an Undead, or a magic item particularly useful against Undead (such as a Mace of Disruption).
reversed_meaning.situation: A serial criminal who has been par- doned for past misdeeds and now continues their wicked ways.

title: WARRIOR
description: A barbarian holds a greataxe. The Warrior card embodies physical strength and fighting acumen.

upright_meaning.person: A person (perhaps a barbarian, fighter, or monk) who has trained in combat or served in the military.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with abilities like those of a barbarian, fighter, or monk.
upright_meaning.place: A training yard or fort where warriors learn combat skills.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable or magical weapon or suit of armor.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires and rewards the skilled application of physical force.

reversed_meaning.person: A bully who uses physical strength to in- timidate others.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that relies on brute strength, or a trap that can be escaped through the application of brute strength.
reversed_meaning.place: A harsh environment where only the physi- cally powerful survive.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An unsubtle work of art.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation involving bullying or extortion.

title: WELL
description: A stone well stands in a peaceful meadow, surrounded by wildflowers. The Well card speaks of drawing resources from familiar places.

upright_meaning.person: A familiar person who is a reliable source of information and aid.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A familiar kind of creature, whose abilities are well understood.
upright_meaning.place: A well, a familiar shop, or a place where fresh water can be found.
upright_meaning.treasure: A reliable treasure (such as gold coins), or a magic item that produces food or water (such as a Decanter of Endless Water or an Al- chemy Jug).
upright_meaning.situation: A familiar situation with a predict- able outcome.

reversed_meaning.person: A familiar person who refuses to provide expected aid.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A familiar kind of creature whose behavior or abilities are surprising.
reversed_meaning.place: A well that has gone dry, or a familiar place that no longer offers the comforts it used to.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure with unexpected proper- ties—a hidden compartment or magical quirk that’s not immediately evident.
reversed_meaning.situation: A familiar situation that ends up defying expectations.

title: VOID
description: An endless void seems to spiral toward a central hole that devours all. This card spells disaster.

upright_meaning.person: A person trapped in despair.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Fiend or an Undead that threatens annihilation of body and soul, or a trap with no easy exit or escape.
upright_meaning.place: A place deep underground, underwater, or in space, where little light and air are available.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object that reflects its creator’s de- spair or sadness, or a Sphere of Annihilation.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that seems to have no good— or even survivable—outcome.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who has lost everything and has no place left to go but up.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A skeleton, zombie, or similar Undead remnant of a living creature; alternatively, a trap that’s broken and nonfunctional.
reversed_meaning.place: A place of utter carnage, where a terrible bat- tle or massacre took place.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure promised but not actually present, such as an empty treasure chest or a looted vault.
reversed_meaning.situation: The aftermath of a destructive event, where the few survivors must figure out how to go on living.

title: TREE
description: A tree has broken through a fortress wall and reclaimed part of the keep. This card suggests perseverance in difficult circumstances.

upright_meaning.person: A strong-willed person determined to per- severe despite hostile conditions.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that thrives in a hos- tile environment.
upright_meaning.place: Somewhere vegetation makes an unex- pected appearance: a park in a busy urban center or a tree growing on barren rock.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure featuring diamonds, pearls, or precious wood, or a magic item that increases endurance (such as an Amulet of Health).
upright_meaning.situation: A small outpost or lone individual hold- ing back a much larger force.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone barely hanging on in hostile conditions.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature driven from its pre- ferred environment and struggling to survive in a new region.
reversed_meaning.place: A place cleared of natural growth.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object or a magic item made from the wood of a tree struck by lightning.
reversed_meaning.situation: An overwhelming threat against a small outpost or lone individual.

title: TOMB
description: A burial chamber holds a plain stone casket. The Tomb card suggests buried secrets and things long forgotten.

upright_meaning.person: A person with a secret or a gap in their memory.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A mummy, wight, or similar Undead that lairs in its own tomb.
upright_meaning.place: A tomb, especially one that is forgotten.
upright_meaning.treasure: Valuable or magical funerary treasure.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation no one wants to talk about or even acknowledge.

reversed_meaning.person: A person trying to atone for a dreadful secret in their past.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: An incorporeal Undead (such as a wraith or specter) that’s not linked to the place of its death, burial place, or body.
reversed_meaning.place: A memorial structure that doesn’t contain a body.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting a dead individual as they were in life.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation stemming from a buried secret that recently came to light.

title: TEMPLE
description: A temple invites worshipers into the serene space within. The Temple card suggests the comfort found in ritual and communion with the divine.

upright_meaning.person: A devout person who performs frequent rituals to invoke divine favor.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A temple guardian—perhaps a Celestial, Construct, or guardian naga.
upright_meaning.place: A temple, shrine, or other place of worship.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable ritual object, such as a candelabra or sacrificial knife, or a magic item linked to worship or divine magic (such as a Candle of Invocation).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation best resolved by an appeal to divine power or spiritual authorities.

reversed_meaning.person: A superstitious person who performs frequent rituals to ward off supernatural evil.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that bestows curses (such as a fomorian, rakshasa, or mummy).
reversed_meaning.place: An area where crime, vice, or other impious behaviors are widespread.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure with superstitious meaning—perhaps an amulet meant to ward off evil (such as a Scarab of Protection).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation stemming from a superstitious fear of curses or bad luck.

title: TALONS
description: A clawed hand reaches to grab an emerald ring, which disintegrates at the claw's approach. The Talons card indicates greed or the rapacious hunger of a predator.

upright_meaning.person: A person who preys on other folk to acquire wealth or power.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A predator, especially one that preys on people or slowly drains their life (such as a vampire).
upright_meaning.place: A place where the rich benefit from the labor of the poor.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that is a collector’s prized possession or the object of a heist.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation driven by someone’s avarice.

reversed_meaning.person: A person trapped by predatory debt or victimized by a monster that slowly drains the person’s life.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature hunted for parts of its body that are considered valuable, or for the treasure it hoards.
reversed_meaning.place: A tenement or workhouse where oppressed victims of the rich live in squalor.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that was stolen from its rightful owner.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation driven by a desperate individual victimized by the greedy.

title: CONSTRUCT
description: A modron wields a wrench in the interior of a vast clockwork machine. This card signifies things made by hand, including Constructs.

upright_meaning.person: An artisan who delights in handcrafted goods.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Construct, particularly one designed to be animated (like a golem) as opposed to an ordinary object (like a broom or rug) that has been animated.
upright_meaning.place: A workshop or art studio.
upright_meaning.treasure: An exquisitely crafted art object (especially one with practical use) or magical tools.
upright_meaning.situation: An artisan attempting to bring a Construct to life.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who scorns the idea of working with their hands.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature able to destroy buildings and objects, such as one with the Siege Monster trait.
reversed_meaning.place: A garbage heap or another place where objects are discarded.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An object fashioned with minimum alteration of its raw materials, or a magic item useful against Constructs (such as a Mace of Smiting).
reversed_meaning.situation: A rueful artisan attempting to destroy a Construct that has broken free of all restraint.

title: CROSSROADS
description: A signpost points in many directions at a crossroads. The Crossroads card warns of a difficult but necessary decision.

upright_meaning.person: A person agonizing about a difficult decision or who regrets a recent decision.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that induces confusion or erratic behavior (such as an umber hulk).
upright_meaning.place: A crossroads, or a settlement where trade routes cross.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object that depicts a crossroads or cross patterns, or a magic item with multiple properties or uses (such as a staff).
upright_meaning.situation: A choice between two options that are equally appealing or equally disastrous.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who refuses to make decisions, relying instead on inaction or random determination.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that prevents others from acting (such as a ghoul).
reversed_meaning.place: A place that constrains movement, such as a narrow ravine or passage.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object featuring overlapping circular patterns, or magic items that does only one thing a limited number of times (such as a wand).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation stemming from someone’s refusal to act or choose.

title: DOOR
description: A large wooden door bars the path ahead. The Door card offers an opportunity to change.

upright_meaning.person: Someone trying to make amends for past misdeeds and adopt a better way of life.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that changes form, or a trapped door.
upright_meaning.place: A place, another doorway, or a passage from various perspectives.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object that looks very different from various perspectives, or a magic item that creates portals or allows teleportation (such as an Amulet of the Planes).
upright_meaning.situation: An opportunity to deal with a situation differently than you have in the past.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who keeps repeating the same mistakes and misdeeds.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that causes its prey or enemies to change, such as a lycanthrope or slaad.
reversed_meaning.place: A locked door or barricaded passage.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A jeweled chest or lockbox, or a magic item that resists change (such as an Immovable Rod).
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that keeps recurring.

title: ELEMENTAL
description: A jungle xorn feeds in an Underdark cavern. This card suggests an elemental creature or reducing a thing to its essence.

upright_meaning.person: A person who uses magic tied to the elements or who can shift dimensional boundaries.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Elemental creature tied to an Elemental Plane or imagery of the elements, or a magic item that conjures or controls Elementals (such as a Ring of Elemental Command).
upright_meaning.place: A place influenced by the Elemental Planes, or associated with an element (such as a cave, a mountain, a volcano, or a river).
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object that depicts material from an Elemental Plane or imagery of the elements, or a magic item that conjures or controls Elementals (such as a Ring of Elemental Command).
upright_meaning.situation: Forces from the Elemental Planes spilling into the world.

reversed_meaning.person: A person driven by an internal conflict between two opposed tendencies or influences.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that combines the substance of two Elemental Planes or creatures from opposing Elemental Planes.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where forces of the Elemental Planes are in opposition to each other.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object that incorporates material from multiple Elemental Planes.
reversed_meaning.situation: Elemental opposition, a magic item useful against Elementals, or forces from two or more Elemental Planes entering the world.

title: EXPERT
description: A bard plays a musical instrument. This card implies expertise, rightly or wrongly applied.

upright_meaning.person: A person (perhaps a bard, a rogue, a ranger, or an artificer) with exactly the right skills for the task at hand.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with abilities similar to those of a bard, ranger, or rogue, such as expertise in one or more skills.
upright_meaning.place: A place (such as a guild hall) where skilled folk gather to share their expertise.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure with practical use, such as a musical instrument or a tool.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that requires and rewards the expert application of practical skills.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who believes themself an expert but isn’t actually helpful.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that relies on brute strength instead of skill or stealth.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where children learn the basics of useful skills.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A wildly impractical treasure with no actual use, unwieldy to wear or display.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation stemming from someone’s expertise being overlooked or ignored.

title: FEY
description: A blink dog runs through the wild. When upright, this card refers to a Fey creature or a sense of whimsy; reversed, it points to the gloomy Shadowfell.

upright_meaning.person: A person with Fey ancestry or some other connection to the Fey (such as a warlock of the Archfey), or a person with a whimsical sense of humor.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Fey creature or some other creature with connections to the Feywild.
upright_meaning.place: A place in the Feywild, somewhere that allows passage to the Feywild, or a location where Fey magic is active.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting Fey or the Feywild, or magic that uses Fey magic.
upright_meaning.situation: An unusual situation that shouldn’t be taken too seriously.

reversed_meaning.person: A gloomy person with no sense of humor, or a person who uses shadow-based magic.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature from the Shadowfell or one transformed by shadow energy (such as a shadow dragon).
reversed_meaning.place: A place in the Shadowfell, somewhere that allows passage to the Shadowfell, or a location where Shadow magic is active.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting the Shadowfell or magic that uses Shadow magic.
reversed_meaning.situation: A gloomy situation that offers little hope of success or escape.

title: FLAMES
description: A chain devil, wreathed in flames, looks menacing and angry. The Flames card brings enemies and vengeance.

upright_meaning.person: A person carrying a bitter, possibly violent, judgment of those involved, or someone’s thirst for revenge.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A vengeful Undead (such as a ghost or revenant) or a creature dedicated to pursuing designated prey (such as an invisible stalker).
upright_meaning.place: A place of bloodshed, or a place with a connection to the Lower Planes.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that has been the subject of intense discord or rivalry, or a magic item originating on the Lower Planes.
upright_meaning.situation: A conflict motivated by deep-seated enmity that clouds the judgment of those involved.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who is being hunted or persecuted unjustly.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature fleeing from a larger or more dangerous foe.
reversed_meaning.place: A place of sanctuary for refugees and fugitives.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure symbolizing or commemorating the end of a feud or war, or a magic item that can charm or calm creatures (such as a Rod of Rulership).
reversed_meaning.situation: Unjust persecution or prejudicial hatred.

title: GEM
description: A large, faceted gemstone set in intricate filigree gleams invitingly. The Gem card implies vast wealth.

upright_meaning.person: Someone who inherited wealth or whose wealth is the result of good fortune.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature connected with wealth, such as a Dragon or xorn, or a treasure hoard.
upright_meaning.place: A mine or a treasure vault.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable treasure or a magical gem.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation driven by greed, such as sibling rivalry, inheritance, or someone hunting for a lost treasure.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who has lost wealth or power through a stroke of bad luck.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A trap or creature that uses the appearance of treasure as bait, such as a mimic.
reversed_meaning.place: A place associated with poverty, such as a tenement or slum.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An item that appears valuable but isn’t, or a magic item with a curse.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation stemming from the loss of wealth, such as a person trying to recover money given to a con artist or stolen by a thief.

title: HUMANOID
description: Kobolds set a trap in their cave lair. This card points to the importance of empathy in relationships with other people.

upright_meaning.person: An empathetic person who’s deeply concerned about the suffering of others.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A shape-shifter that takes on Humanoid appearance to prey on others or learn from them, or to influence them for their good.
upright_meaning.place: A place where diverse people live together in harmony.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure representing the collaboration of different artisans (such as a finely cut gem set in exquisite jewelry), or a magic item that facilitates cooperation.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that calls for empathy and compassion, if it is to be resolved without violence.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone who feels no empathy for others.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A shape-shifter that takes on Humanoid appearance to prey on others.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where people live apart from others, by choice or by force (such as a monastery or a cultural retreat).
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting or celebrating war, alternatively, a magic item made to be used in war, or that is especially useful against Humanoids.
reversed_meaning.situation: A violent situation arising from a lack of empathy.

title: KEY
description: This large metal key is bizarrely complicated. The Key card represents the perfect solution to a problem or having the right tool for the job.

upright_meaning.person: A person with the skills or tools needed to solve the current problem.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that preys on the party’s weaknesses, or a trap that can be disarmed only with a key.
upright_meaning.place: A place through which only certain people are allowed to pass, or where a key is required.
upright_meaning.treasure: A magic item needed to overcome an obstacle or defeat an enemy, or the means to unlock a treasure (such as a Chime of Opening).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that can be resolved successfully only by taking a specific action.

reversed_meaning.person: A person ill equipped for the challenges they face.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature with vulnerabilities, or a trap that’s bizarrely complex.
reversed_meaning.place: An open and easily accessed place.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure in a locked container, or magic that slows creatures.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that can be successfully resolved in many ways.

title: LANCE
description: An ornate dragonlance shines among more ordinary weapons on a rack. The Lance card warns that healing sometimes requires additional injury, as when infection must be cut away.

upright_meaning.person: A surgeon, or someone (such as a guard or soldier) who uses violence in pursuit of worthy societal goals.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature trained to fight alongside guards or soldiers.
upright_meaning.place: A place where surgery is performed.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure made at great cost, or a magic weapon.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation in which additional pain is required to bring healing.

reversed_meaning.person: A person committed to pacifism or avoiding harm.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature uninterested in fighting or a trap that restrains but doesn’t cause damage.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where violence is forbidden.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure celebrating the end of hostilities or the ideal of peace, or a magic item intended to prevent or end conflict.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation complicated by people avoiding any hint of conflict.

title: MAP
description: X marks the spot on an elaborate treasure map. The Map card provides guidance that leads to the goal of the quest.

upright_meaning.person: A person who acts as a guide, showing the way forward.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that tracks by scent.
upright_meaning.place: A path or road.
upright_meaning.treasure: A valuable map (perhaps a jeweled globe or rare atlas), or a magic item that provides direction.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation best navigated with a guide.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone who tries to lead you on the wrong path.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature (such as a will-o’-wisp) that leads travelers astray.
reversed_meaning.place: A demiplane or similar place that can’t be found on maps, or a location hidden behind a secret door.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure from another plane of existence, or a magic item that creates or accesses an extradimensional space (like a Portable Hole).
reversed_meaning.situation: No guide or direction is available.

title: MINE
description: A well-crafted pick leans against a wall at the entrance to a mine. The Mine card represents something valuable underground or buried in the earth.

upright_meaning.person: A miner or an archaeologist.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that burrows underground, especially one that delves into the earth in search of prey (such as a giant weasel).
upright_meaning.place: A mine, an archaeological dig, or a similar excavated site.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure from the earth, such as metal ore or gems, or any treasure that has been buried.
upright_meaning.situation: Something unearthed that should have remained buried.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone who places things in the earth, such as a gardener or an undertaker.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that lives underground but hunts above ground (such as an ankheg or a bulette).
reversed_meaning.place: A place that has sunk into the earth, perhaps swallowed in a sinkhole or covered in a mudslide.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure buried in the earth.
reversed_meaning.situation: The retrieval of something buried.

title: MOON
description: A crescent moon looms large in the autumn sky. The Moon card points to hidden potential.

upright_meaning.person: Someone whose fine qualities are masked by one annoying trait.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A lycanthrope, or a creature that appears to be an inanimate object until it strikes (such as a gargoyle).
upright_meaning.place: A secret chamber, or a place concealed by terrain; alternatively, a place larger or more elaborate on the inside than it seems from outside.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure whose value isn’t immediately apparent, or a magic item that appears to be a mundane object.
upright_meaning.situation: A problem that requires investigation and is more complicated than it appears.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who seems competent but bungles everything they attempt.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that uses its fearsome appearance to frighten away others because it is too weak to fight.
reversed_meaning.place: A place with an impressive exterior but a dingy, poorly maintained interior.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that seems more valuable than it is, perhaps an ordinary item that falsely appears magical.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation that seems—and is—too good to be true.

title: PATH
description: A well-worn path twists through the wilderness, with hidden dangers lurking in the shadows to both sides. This card suggests the importance of sticking with a plan and remaining focused on the destination.

upright_meaning.person: A goal-oriented person who knows exactly what they want and has a clear plan to get it.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A single-minded predator pursuing prey, or something deadly acting on instinct or purpose; it might be a trapped room navigable by only a single path.
upright_meaning.place: A road or trail.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object depicting a road or path.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation that demands unwavering focus on the goal.

reversed_meaning.person: An aimless person who doesn’t know what they want and has no idea how to decide.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that reacts to provocation without a plan or purpose.
reversed_meaning.place: A trackless wilderness or an underground complex that is very difficult to traverse.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An abstract art object, or a magic item that foils divination (such as an Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location).
reversed_meaning.situation: A series of distractions that deflect attention from an important goal.

title: PLANT
description: A myconid emits a cloud of spores. The Plant card reflects growth and natural life.

upright_meaning.person: A person who lives in the wilderness among trees and other growing things.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A plant creature, a creature that affects the growth of plants, or an awakened tree or shrub.
upright_meaning.place: A verdant place where vegetation grows wild, untouched by people’s hands.
upright_meaning.treasure: An art object crafted from wood or incorporating leaves; alternatively, a magic item that allows uncontrolled vegetation growth (such as a Bag of Beans).
upright_meaning.situation: Something growing out of control with surprising, even supernatural speed.

reversed_meaning.person: A quiet person who enjoys gardening or farming, finding greenery more relatable than people.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A domesticated plant given artificial animation, such as an awakened tree or shrub.
reversed_meaning.place: A place full of carefully pruned and neatly controlled vegetation, such as a topiary garden.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that incorporates living greenery, such as an ornate terrarium, or a magic item that controls vegetation growth (such as a Staff of the Woodlands).
reversed_meaning.situation: A conflict between a region suffering a famine and a region with abundant crops.

title: PRISONER
description: A rogue begs for release from a dark prison cell. The Prisoner card represents someone or something locked and hidden away.

upright_meaning.person: A person held captive or bound by expectations.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature locked away to prevent it from harming people.
upright_meaning.place: A place where things are put to keep them out of reach and memory, such as a securely locked area or a jail.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure stored in a locked container, or a magic item that contains a creature (such as an Elemental Gem or an Iron Flask).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation arising from efforts to keep a person, an object, or information out of reach.

reversed_meaning.person: An individual who defies societal norms and expectations.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that grapples, swallows, or otherwise binds or imprisons its prey.
reversed_meaning.place: A place where something or someone is kept on public display.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A prominently displayed treasure, such as a ruler’s regalia.
reversed_meaning.situation: The theft or liberation of a person, or an object on public display.

title: RING
description: An emerald ring glows within a decorative jewelry box. The Ring card suggests both a promise and the honor involved in keeping it.

upright_meaning.person: Someone scrupulously faithful to a promise.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that has promised to serve someone.
upright_meaning.place: A place where oaths are sworn, such as a temple or courthouse.
upright_meaning.treasure: A ring, either jewelry or a magic item.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation complicated by a person’s promise to do something.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who resents being bound to an oath sworn in haste or duress.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature unwillingly bound to serve someone (such as an invisible stalker).
reversed_meaning.place: A place where a legendary figure was coerced into swearing an oath that led to their downfall.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A bracelet or magic bracers.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation arising from someone trying to abjure an oath.

title: RUIN
description: An elegant sword and crown disintegrate into eddies of ash. The Ruin card warns of the inevitability of decay and the danger of material attachments.

upright_meaning.person: A person who has renounced material attachments, such as a religious ascetic.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that destroys equipment, such as a rust monster or a black pudding.
upright_meaning.place: A ruin, or a retreat for ascetics.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure that is broken or in disrepair.
upright_meaning.situation: A situation involving the decay of objects or relationships over a long period of time.

reversed_meaning.person: A person excessively attached to material goods (not necessarily excessive wealth).
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A Construct, especially an animated object.
reversed_meaning.place: A place meant to store goods, such as a warehouse or an armory.
reversed_meaning.treasure: Valuable trade goods, well-made equipment, or a deed to property.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation involving the production or transportation of goods for sale.

title: SHIELD
description: A circular shield is close at hand in a military barrack. The Shield card is a reminder of the need for protection.

upright_meaning.person: A protective parent or sibling, or a professional protector such as a sentry or guard.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that protects others, such as a watchdog or shield guardian, or a warding trap designed to repel invaders.
upright_meaning.place: A defensive structure, such as a fortress or a wall.
upright_meaning.treasure: A suit of armor that is valuable or magical.
upright_meaning.situation: Someone who must protect those who can’t protect themselves.

reversed_meaning.person: A guarded person who carefully shields themself from physical or emotional harm.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A heavily armored creature.
reversed_meaning.place: A hermitage or retreat meant to isolate one person from others.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A suit of armor that is valuable but impractical.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation arising from someone selfishly protecting themself without heed to others.

title: SKULL
description: A skeletal figure is shrouded in a swirling robe, though its skull is clearly visible. The Skull card is a reminder of the universality of death—and the fact that everyone must confront death alone.

upright_meaning.person: A person facing imminent death, or one who wields necromantic power.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An Undead creature, or a trap that deals necrotic damage.
upright_meaning.place: A place of solitude and isolation, or a place where someone died recently.
upright_meaning.treasure: A treasure associated with death (perhaps funerary implements), or a magic item with necromantic power.
upright_meaning.situation: A person’s life in peril.

reversed_meaning.person: Someone haunted by the inevitability of death and seeking to escape it, or a person who has returned from death.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: An immortal creature or one that doesn’t age, such as an angel, a Fiend, or a naga.
reversed_meaning.place: A graveyard or another place where the dead are gathered.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object that celebrates or depicts deliverance from death, or a magic item that wards off death (such as a Periapt of Wound Closure or a Scarab of Protection).
reversed_meaning.situation: Many lives at stake.

title: STAIRWAY
description: A spiral stairway leads both up and down, but the downward stairs are cluttered and dark. This card points to a change in difficulty either increasing or decreasing.

upright_meaning.person: A person who makes every task more difficult than it needs to be, adding complications and getting in the way.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that grows in power as battle continues (such as a black pudding or a hydra).
upright_meaning.place: A place reached by descending stairs, such as a basement or a lower level of a dungeon.
upright_meaning.treasure: An intricate treasure that was difficult to create, or a magic item that helps accomplish difficult tasks (such as an Ioun Stone of Mastery).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation more complicated or challenging than it appears.

reversed_meaning.person: A helpful, friendly person who makes everything easier (or at least more pleasant).
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that is difficult to fight at first but becomes easier to defeat as the battle proceeds.
reversed_meaning.place: A place reached by ascending stairs, such as an attic or upper level of a dungeon.
reversed_meaning.treasure: A treasure that is simple and elegant.
reversed_meaning.situation: A situation much simpler than it appears.

title: STATUE
description: A statue depicts the god Istus offering the original Deck of Many Things as a gift. The Statue card is a reminder of the past.

upright_meaning.person: Someone who takes great pride in a prominent ancestor.
upright_meaning.creature_or_trap: An ancient creature that played an important part in a historical event.
upright_meaning.place: A park or plaza built around a statue.
upright_meaning.treasure: A statuette or sculpture, either valuable or magical (such as a Figurine of Wondrous Power).
upright_meaning.situation: A situation with remarkable similarities to a significant historical event.

reversed_meaning.person: A person who lives in the shadow of a famous or important ancestor.
reversed_meaning.creature_or_trap: A creature that clings to a memory of fallen glory (such as a storm giant or a mind flayer), or a creature in the guise of a statue (such as a mimic), or a statue that functions as a trap.
reversed_meaning.place: An immense ruin left behind by an ancient civilization.
reversed_meaning.treasure: An art object made in imitation of a more famous and valuable piece.
reversed_meaning.situation: An attempt to re-create a historical situation or rebuild a fallen empire.
